intro: Cissampelos psilophylla, commonly known as the slender leaf moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and long, trailing stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its family with unique adaptations for its ecological niche.
